sections.title: Introduction to Martin Luther King Jr.
sections.description: Students will learn about the early life of MLK Jr. and his growing awareness of racial injustice.
learning_objectives: Students will recognize the early influences on MLK Jr.'s life.
Students will identify key aspects of MLK Jr.'s childhood.
Students will understand the influence of MLK's family and community on his views.
sections.what_must_be_covered: The early life of Martin Luther King Jr., including his family background, education, and childhood experiences.
search_queries_used: Martin Luther King Jr. early life

video_resources.title: The Story of Martin Luther King Jr. | In Memory of Greatest Civil Rights Leader | Dr. Binocs Show
video_resources.description:
Martin Luther King Jr. was an American Baptist minister, activist, and political philosopher who was one of the most prominent leaders in the civil rights movement from 1955 until his assassination in 1968.

#martinlutherking #martinlutherkingday #civilrightsleader #greatleader #drbinocsshow #birthdaytribute 

Make sure you watch the whole video to know all the answers to your curious questions!

video_resources.title: Martin Luther King Jr.'s Childhood Years | Drive Thru History with Dave Stotts
video_resources.channel_name: Drive Thru History with Dave Stotts
video_resources.description:
Drive Thru History: In this clip taken from our Martin Luther King Jr. special,  Dave Stotts is in Atlanta, Georgia at MLK's childhood home. We see where Dr. King grew up, where he went to school, and his first experience of racism. We'll also go inside the church Martin Luther King pastored until his death.

Watch the FULL special here! - https://watch.tbn.org/videos/drive-thru-history-special-martin-luther-king-jr-2021

Enjoy this clip from Drive Thru History®: American Holidays, broadcast on

worksheet_options.worksheet_title: Martin Luther King Jr. Cut-and-Paste Timeline
worksheet_options.subject: ELA
worksheet_options.description: Students read a passage about Martin Luther King Jr., then cut out events and place them in the correct order on a timeline.
strengths: Engages students with a hands-on activity

relevance_data.reasoning: The resource is suitable for grade 5 and covers the topic of Martin Luther King Jr., but it primarily focuses on historical sequencing rather than the specific early influences and family aspects of MLK Jr.'s life.

sections.title: A Brief History of Slavery in America
sections.description: Students will explore the history and impact of slavery in America.
learning_objectives: Students will gain an understanding of the historical context of slavery.
Students will summarize the history of slavery in America.
Students will describe the conditions faced by enslaved people.
sections.what_must_be_covered: The origins and development of slavery in America, the conditions faced by enslaved people, and the abolition movement.

sections.title: The Civil Rights Movement
sections.description: Students will learn about the key events and figures in the Civil Rights Movement.
learning_objectives: Students will understand the significance of the Civil Rights Movement.
Students will identify major events and figures in the Civil Rights Movement.
Students will explain the movement's impact on society.
sections.what_must_be_covered: An overview of the Civil Rights Movement, including major events, figures, and its impact on American society.

video_resources.description:

sections.title: The Montgomery Bus Boycott
sections.description: Students will learn about the Montgomery Bus Boycott and its significance.
learning_objectives: Students will understand the impact of the Montgomery Bus Boycott.
Students will understand what sparked the Montgomery Bus Boycott.
Students will identify key people involved.
Students will explain how the boycott worked and its outcome.
sections.what_must_be_covered: The arrest of Rosa Parks, how the boycott was organized, the role of MLK, how long it lasted, and its success.

worksheet_options.subject: Social Studies
worksheet_options.description: Students complete a chart by matching causes with their effects related to Rosa Parks and the Civil Rights Movement.
strengths: Encourages understanding of cause and effect

relevance_data.reasoning: The resource covers Rosa Parks and the Civil Rights Movement, which aligns with some key topics. However, it does not fully address the specific details of the Montgomery Bus Boycott, such as its impact, key people involved, and the 381-day duration.

sections.title: The 'I Have a Dream' Speech
sections.description: Students will analyze the significance of MLK Jr.'s famous speech.
learning_objectives: Students will appreciate the significance of the 'I Have a Dream' speech.
Students will analyze the main themes of the 'I Have a Dream' speech.
Students will understand the historical context and impact of the speech.
sections.what_must_be_covered: The main themes and historical context of the 'I Have a Dream' speech and its impact on the Civil Rights Movement.
search_queries_used: MLK I Have a Dream analysis

video_resources.title: An analysis of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr's "I Have a Dream" public speech
video_resources.description:
This video is on effective communication, using Martin Luther King's "I Have a Dream" public speech as a case study. Nancy Duarte analyzed the structure, rhetorical devices, and content of the speech to demonstrate how Dr. King effectively conveyed his message and engaged his audience.

*Topics*

*Analysis of Martin Luther King's "I Have a Dream" speech*
--Nancy Duarte broke down King's speech into its components, analyzing the rhythm, pauses, and use of rhetorical devices.
--Nancy Duarte noted

activity_options.name: PBS Video of 5th Graders Reflecting on King's Speech
activity_options.description: Watch a PBS video of 5th graders reflecting on King's speech at the Lincoln Memorial.
steps: Discuss the reflections shared by the students
learning_objectives: Reflect on the impact of King's 'I Have a Dream' speech

relevance_data.reasoning: The resource matches the grade level and topic but only partially covers the learning objectives, focusing mainly on reflection rather than analysis or historical context.

sections.title: Comparing Past and Present: Racial Injustice
sections.description: Students will compare historical and current instances of racial injustice.
learning_objectives: Students will understand the connections between past and present racial injustices.
Students will compare historical and current examples of racial injustice.
Students will discuss social progress and ongoing challenges.
sections.what_must_be_covered: A comparison of historical and current instances of racial injustice, including social progress and ongoing challenges.

sections.title: Art Project: Symbols of the Civil Rights Movement
sections.description: Students will create art representing symbols of the Civil Rights Movement.
learning_objectives: Students will express understanding of the Civil Rights Movement through art.
Students will create art pieces representing Civil Rights symbols.
Students will explain the significance of their chosen symbols.
sections.what_must_be_covered: Creating art that represents symbols of the Civil Rights Movement, with a focus on creativity and reflection on the chosen symbols.

sections.title: Exploring MLK Jr.'s Speeches
sections.description: Students will explore various speeches by MLK Jr. and their messages.
learning_objectives: Students will appreciate MLK Jr.'s skills as a speaker.
Students will analyze themes and messages in MLK Jr.'s speeches.
Students will identify rhetorical techniques used in the speeches.
sections.what_must_be_covered: An exploration of various MLK Jr. speeches, focusing on themes, messages, and rhetorical techniques.

video_resources.title: ENGLISH SPEECH | MARTIN LUTHER KING JR.: I Have a Dream! (English Subtitles)
video_resources.description:
Learn English with Martin Luther King Jr. MLK delivers his powerful and historic "I Have a Dream" speech during the March on Washington. This speech, symbolizing the fight for equality and justice, resonates with the aspirations of millions for a society free from discrimination and segregation. King's eloquent words and compelling vision continue to inspire the quest for civil rights and freedom for all.

⭐️ Download this speech's LESSONS, TRANSCRIPT, and AUDIO here:
https://www.englishspeeches

sections.title: The Role of Youth in the Civil Rights Movement
sections.description: Students will learn about the involvement of youth in the Civil Rights Movement.
learning_objectives: Students will recognize the contributions of young people to the movement.
Students will identify the role of youth in the Civil Rights Movement.
Students will describe the impact of youth activism on the movement.
sections.what_must_be_covered: The involvement of youth in the Civil Rights Movement, including major contributions and impact.

sections.title: Panel Discussion: The Relevance of MLK Jr.'s Teachings Today
sections.description: Students will participate in a panel discussion about the relevance of MLK Jr.'s teachings today.
learning_objectives: Students will articulate the relevance of MLK Jr.'s teachings in today's world.
Students will engage in a panel discussion on the relevance of MLK Jr.'s teachings today.
Students will develop communication and critical thinking skills.

video_resources.title: Martin Luther King Jr for Kids|  Black History Month for Kids
video_resources.description:
Discover the inspiring story of Martin Luther King Jr., one of the greatest leaders in American history! In this kid-friendly video, we’ll explore his early life, his dream of equality, and his powerful role in the Civil Rights Movement. Learn how Dr. King fought for justice through peaceful protests and how his famous "I Have a Dream" speech changed the world.

As we celebrate Black History Month, this video helps children understand why Martin Luther King Jr.’s message of love, unity, and fair

video_resources.title: Martin Luther King Jr. song - Kids Learn about MLK #blackhistorymonth #simplesongs #specialeducation
video_resources.description:
Who was Martin Luther King and why is there a national holiday marking his birthday? Celebrate Dr. King’s legacy by helping children understand the importance of love, justice and equality with this fun and catchy song.  With inspiring images of Martin Luther King Jr. and AAC images,  this catchy song appeals to learners of ALL ages and abilities!  Sing along and learn for Martin Luther King Jr. day and Black History Month.  

#mlksong #martinlutherkingday #whowasmlk #martinlutherkingforkids #ma

sections.title: Creating a Nonviolent Protest Plan
sections.description: Students will create a plan for a nonviolent protest on a current issue.
learning_objectives: Students will apply nonviolent strategies to modern issues.
Students will create a detailed plan for a nonviolent protest.
Students will present their plan to the class.
sections.what_must_be_covered: Creating a plan for a nonviolent protest addressing a current issue, including strategies and a class presentation.

video_resources.title: How to turn protest into powerful change - Eric Liu
video_resources.description:
View full lesson: http://ed.ted.com/lessons/how-to-turn-protest-into-powerful-change-eric-liu

We live in an age of protest. On campuses, in public squares, on streets and social media, protestors around the world are challenging the status quo. But while protest is often necessary, is it sufficient? Eric Liu outlines three strategies for peacefully turning awareness into action and protest into durable political power. 

Lesson by Eric Liu, animation by Sarah Saidan.

video_resources.title: Mahatma Gandhi, The Salt March, The Dandi March: Learn English (IND)
video_resources.description:
Learn about "The Salt March" also called the "The Dandi march", a non violent protest organized by Mahatma Gandhi. This event later became a turning point in the history of the Indian independence movement.
